intro: Acnida cannabina var. cuspidata, commonly known as the sharp-pointed acnida, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to parts of southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it grows in grassy areas and along riverbanks. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, hairy leaves with pointed tips. Its flowers are typically yellow or greenish-yellow, clustered in dense, spherical inflorescences. It is often used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
